item.title: Arithmetic Progressions
item.description: Introduction Arithmetic Progression (AP) is basically a series of numbers that are increasing/progressing by a fixed common difference. Examples Example 1: The natural numbers follow an arithmetic progression : $$ AP: 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, … $$ Here, one is added to a number to get the next number in the series. $$ 1 = 1\\ 1+1 = 2\\ 2+1 = 3\\ 3+1 = 4\\ 4+1 = 5\\ 5+1 = 6\\ … $$
